main event: A radar-detected unidentified object in Clovis, New Mexico, observed for approximately 15 minutes on April 24, 1964, before it disappeared.
interesting points: The object was stationary before making a rapid ascent, it was detected on both military and civilian radar, the observers reported it faded from sight with no visible trail, all observations took place during a clear night, and descriptions varied among multiple reliable witnesses.
witness description: military personnel and reliable civilian observers
